That wasn't the style he was playing.... He came up with some of the greatest songs and riffs in history? I think he took plenty of risks His signature sloppy style was a risk he took He was sloppy at least mostly on purpose, I'll admit some of it was the drugs, but if you've ever heard jimmy playing when he was a teenager or in any other style you would know he wasn't sloppy completely on accident. Their music had the feeling that it could fall apart at any moment, but they kept it on the edge. It was exciting, different, and risk taking for the time that THEY were making music. I hate when people forget that if the legends didn't make the music that they did, music wouldn't have evolved the way it did, and your "imaginative, risk taking music" might not be around. SRV covered tons of jimi and made it his own, does that make him unoriginal and "just a good guitarist"? JESUS. I have no clue how your head fit up your ass with it being so large.
I think had your guitar!!! I broke it for a school play I was in so it no longer exists, but I had it. That paint job was horrible

I know you wanna find the owner and all... But did you play it? ... At least a little? I couldn't resist Who knows, maybe playing it will show you some of the previous owners memories like when a vampire sucks someone's blood. It's worth a try. You know... For science
But really, I'm glad you're doing the right thing.

Anytime you need me man

Sometimes I don't really want advice, though. It makes me feel worse. Sometimes I just need someone to do what you did, listen and tell me it's going to be okay. Thank you for that If you ever need to talk to someone, pm me and I'll be there I read some of your posts on here and I think we go through a lot of the same things, especially when I was your age. Just know it does get better... You'll have great days, okay days, and absolutely terrible days, but it always gets better.
We cuddled for about 2 hours before she went to bed:) She feels better and I do mostly I just wish I could avoid making her feel that way
Thank you so much

WRITING.TITLE: Need help. Mostly just someone to listen
WRITING.TEXT:
I got mad at my fianc tonight for basically no reason/: had a huge anxiety attack and made her cry because she felt bad for "hurting my feelings" I asked her if she wanted to cuddle and she said she was comfy (she was half asleep and not really meaning any harm) but, because of how an ex used to treat me at the end of our relationship, I thought she didn't want me to touch her and I got upset and embarrassed/: I felt like I was being a nuisance and ruining things I know she will get used to my anxiety eventually I just don't want to hurt her right now Sometimes I just feel like if I didn't have anxiety all of my problems would be fixed, I would hurt the ones I love as much, and I would have achieved so much more in life Ya know?
Sorry if this was hard to follow I just needed to get it out...
I would say to find a new girl if that is the way she is going to support your dreams.
I will! Thank you for the source!

No problems! Meditation is as simple as closing your eyes, taking 5-7 deep breaths and focusing on an imaginary object (I normally imagine a ball) and focus only on that. People portray meditation as some hard thing that takes years to perfect, but the kind of medication that can help people like us is simple as 123, your just focusing on something to clear your mind and equalize yourself. Some people imagine a happy place or memory, it can literally be anything as long as you focus only on it. Meditation can become more advanced and if it is something you like you can then do some research online for various techniques and "mind exercises" I am much more at peace after starting meditation

Exactly I love talking to someone else with anxiety, they understand and are really sympathetic most of the time. People without it that are close to me, like my brother, try to understand, but they've never experienced it so there is no way that they can understand like someone who has, and they don't get that I can't just shrug it off and "just don't think about it" doesn't work.

I explain general anxiety disorder to people that way all the time A normal person on a normal day has anxiety at 1-2 at most on a scale of 1-10 Someone with general anxiety disorder on a normal day is sitting around a 5-7 on a scale of 1-10. On a bad day it can get to ten very easily for us.
I never knew so many people felt the way I do just thinking about that makes the problem seem smaller! Thank you! And the same goes for you
Thank you for responding It means a lot to me!
I totally relate to the feeling of being late! It's one of my biggest triggers Thank you for responding!

Thank you for responding! It feels better just to know someone else understands! I practice various meditation techniques that have helped me tremendously. I would do some research into that, you may feel silly at first, but once you realize that you feeling silly is just your anxiety acting, you can really block everything else out and equalize yourself. It is truly a peaceful way to start your day. Even when you don't feel anxious, it can be preventative to start the day in a clear mindset. I hope you start to feel better and if you ever need to talk you can message me anytime! I understand frustration because of anxiety all too well

WRITING.TITLE: Does anyone feel like their anxiety has stages, or levels, of severity?
WRITING.TEXT:
I have been suffering from panic attacks since I was very young (like 5-7 years old). It has always been such a huge part of my life, and I always tried to hide from it, like if I didn't talk about it it would go away. The first purpose of this post is to say thank you to everyone on this sub. I just recently discovered this place and it is so awesome to see a community band together like this! Reading some of your posts have helped me feel less like a sociopath because I have seen several people describing the way anxiety feels, the thoughts it gives you, and some of the physical symptoms, and I feel/have the majority of the symptoms I've read. It really helps to know I'm not alone. Which brings me to the real purpose of the post: My therapist and I have determined my panic attacks have stages or levels. Explanation: Level 1- tight chest, a little shaky, sweaty, brain running a mile a minute, trouble focusing, generally quiet. (I can normally do several thought exercises to stop a panic attack at this level) Level 2-intense anger at myself for feeling the way I do. It often gets taken out on others. Adrenaline takes over a little, and I have hurt myself before. (Some one I trust, normally my fianc or my mom, can usually talk me down from this stage. Listening to peaceful music also helps.) Level 3- extreme sadness, I have several ticks and twitches that are caused by anxiety that become magnified at this level, I shake extremely bad, my stutter from when I was younger comes back to the point that I can't even speak a sentence over 4 words, and that is still pushing it. (The only way I can escape from this level is being alone or being held by my fianc until it passes[2-4 hours]) Level 4- I shut down completely, curl into a ball and stare into nothing. I don't want to eat, sleep, shower, talk, or do anything at all. I can't bring myself to talk for fear of how I sound, or what I might say. The shaking and twitching continue without me trying to control it. (These are the worst and I have only had a few hand-full of them but they can sometimes last for days at a time, the only way to get me back is to let it pass or give me a Xanax and let me pass out. Only problem with that is that I hate the way medicine makes me feel.)
I just wanted to know if anybody else had some of the same experiences as me, or felt like their anxiety had levels with different symptoms. Please comment and tell me if anyone is out there... I've been feeling more and more like a sociopath lately /:
I ended up getting 11s They worked out!
That's okay I'm just trying them out but I love them so far so it might be trouble!!
Thanks man!! Cleared it right up

What I should have learned in study hall by ice nine kills It's actually in drop c but you can play it in drop d to make it easier and it still sounds good and very fun to play

I learned that now I'm getting in to finding and building my own chord shapes and voicings. After a while you'll be able to say "I have to play a Fmaj7 followed by a dm7" and Instead of playing the open chord voicing you can realize that you can keep the same bar shape as the dm7 on the fifth fret and play EX A8 D7 G5 B5 e5 To make it super easy to transition to the dm7 EX A5 D7 G5 B6 e5 It makes life so much easier

My first electric was a stagg tele copy It lasted me a while before I upgraded If you put some nice pickups in it, it'll be a way better guitar If I remember correctly the neck wasnt too bad but I would definitely play it first
